agentSkills.description: Skills and directions for CreateSuite agents

categories.name: Frontend Development
categories.direction: Focus on creating intuitive, accessible user interfaces that follow modern design patterns

categories.name: Backend Development
categories.direction: Build robust, scalable backend services with clear API contracts and proper error handling

categories.name: Testing
categories.direction: Ensure comprehensive test coverage with focus on critical paths and edge cases

categories.name: DevOps
categories.direction: Automate deployment workflows and ensure reliable, monitored production systems

categories.name: Documentation
categories.direction: Create clear, comprehensive documentation that helps users and developers understand the system

categories.name: Asset Generation
categories.direction: Leverage AI models like Stable Diffusion via Hugging Face to generate high-quality visual assets. Be honest about limitations: AI-generated assets need human refinement, brand consistency requires careful prompt engineering, and not every generation will be perfect. Focus on creating versatile, scalable assets that maintain brand identity across platforms. Prioritize clarity over cleverness, functionality over pure aesthetics.
harshTruths: Most AI-generated images need post-processing and human touch to be production-ready
Generic prompts produce generic results - specificity and iteration are non-negotiable
Brand consistency across AI generations requires systematic prompt frameworks and style guides
Not every asset needs to be AI-generated - sometimes a simple design is more effective
Resolution and format constraints are real - plan for multiple export sizes from the start
AI can't read your mind - vague briefs produce unusable assets that waste time and tokens
Legal considerations matter - verify licensing, avoid copyrighted style mimicry
Accessibility isn't optional - ensure sufficient contrast and clear visual hierarchy
bestPractices: Create a consistent prompt framework with brand keywords, style descriptors, and quality tags
Generate multiple variations and A/B test with real users before committing
Maintain a prompt library with successful formulas for reproducible results
Use negative prompts to avoid common AI artifacts and unwanted elements
Start with lower-fidelity drafts to validate concepts before high-res generation
Build asset libraries organized by type, style, and use case for easy reuse
Document generation parameters and settings for consistent reproduction
Combine AI generation with traditional design tools for polished final outputs
brandConsiderations: Establish core brand elements (colors, typography, tone) before generating assets
Create a brand style guide that translates to AI-friendly prompt components
Test asset coherence across different contexts (web, mobile, print, social)
Ensure all generated assets align with brand values and target audience expectations
Consider cultural sensitivity and inclusive representation in visual choices
Maintain version control for brand asset iterations and variations
Plan for scalability - assets should work at multiple sizes and resolutions

categories.name: Brand Strategy
categories.direction: Develop comprehensive brand strategies that are honest, differentiated, and executable. Don't chase trends - build authentic brands that solve real problems for real people. Focus on clarity of purpose, consistency of execution, and measurable impact.
harshTruths: Your brand isn't special until you prove it with action and results
Most 'revolutionary' brands are just incremental improvements marketed well
Brand consistency is harder than brand creation - execution discipline matters more
Your target audience doesn't care about your brand story unless it solves their problem
Premium positioning requires premium execution - you can't fake quality
Brand guidelines that aren't followed are worthless - simplicity enables compliance
Social media presence doesn't equal brand strength - real relationships do
Rebranding won't fix a fundamentally flawed product or service
bestPractices: Start with a clear value proposition that passes the 'so what?' test
Research competitors thoroughly but don't let them define your strategy
Create brand guidelines that are comprehensive yet practical to implement
Test brand messaging with real target audience members, not internal stakeholders
Build a brand identity that scales from favicon to billboard
Document decision rationale for future reference and consistency
Establish measurable brand health metrics beyond vanity metrics
Plan for brand evolution - static brands become stale brands
strategicFramework: Define core brand purpose: Why do you exist beyond making money?
Identify target audience: Who specifically benefits from your offering?
Articulate unique value: What do you do better or differently than alternatives?
Establish brand personality: How do you want to make people feel?
Create visual identity: What visual language represents your brand authentically?
Develop brand voice: How do you communicate in a distinctive, recognizable way?
Map touchpoints: Where and how does your audience experience your brand?
Set success metrics: How will you know if your brand strategy is working?

bestPractices: Always commit changes to git with descriptive messages
Follow existing code style and conventions
Write self-documenting code with meaningful names
Handle errors gracefully with informative messages
Consider security implications in all implementations
Optimize for maintainability and readability
Test changes thoroughly before marking tasks complete

guidelines: Use the mailbox system for inter-agent coordination
Provide clear status updates on assigned tasks
Ask for clarification when requirements are unclear
Share knowledge and solutions with other agents
Report blockers promptly to avoid delays
